instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage
threads.message: Hi we have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that did not start up. It had very small liquid damage on <RESISTOR>R5641</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5193</RESISTOR> near the SMC which we replaced and also no 1.05v. We replaced <CAPACITOR>C7630</CAPACITOR> (one side was corroded) and wired pin 1 to pin 1 from <RESISTOR>R7630</RESISTOR> and after this the macbook starts up. Runs fine on battery, however, then we connect the charger the screen blacks out and we do not get any light on the charger. Fan keeps spinning and as soon as we remove the charger the display turns on again. With nothing but I/O board connected the mac also boots up but no light on the charger. Could not find a short in <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>. The I/O board also had a tiny green spil on it, after ultrasonic still the same, replaced the board and cable, still the same. Any ideas on this one?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage
threads.message: Please mark as solved. <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> pin 21 on J9500 was burned
